references.description: Best-performing Rust HNSW implementation (62K req/s fashion-mnist, 15K req/s sift1m). Uses simdeez for SIMD, parking_lot for concurrency. Reference for SIMD distance functions and parallel construction.
Clean, minimal pure-Rust HNSW implementation. Production-tested at Instant Domain Search. Good reference for trait-based distance metrics and clean API design.
Paper-first HNSW implementation built directly from Malkov-Yashunin paper (not ported from C++). Serde support, no_std capable. Good reference for canonical algorithm implementation.
Multi-algorithm ANN library with HNSW, SSG, PQIVF. Uses packed_simd, supports WebAssembly. Reference for multiple index types and SIMD acceleration patterns.
Portable SIMD with runtime CPU feature detection and automatic dispatch. Powers faer linear algebra library. Supports AVX2, AVX-512, NEON with FMA. Key library for stable Rust SIMD.
Official Rust portable SIMD implementation (std::simd). Nightly only but will eventually stabilize. Reference for portable SIMD API design and vector operations.
High-performance linear algebra library using pulp for SIMD. Reference for optimized matrix operations and SIMD kernel patterns. AVX-512 support on nightly.
Zero-copy deserialization framework. 1.2ns access time. Ideal for HNSW index persistence with instant load times. Works with #[derive] macros.
Google's zero-cost memory manipulation library. Rigorously tested with Miri. Essential for safe byte-to-type casting in tape-based storage patterns.
Fast bump allocation arena. Ideal for phase-oriented allocations in HNSW construction (batch node insertions). Fast allocation with bulk deallocation.
Simple fixed-size bitset with SIMD acceleration (AVX). Perfect for visited node tracking in HNSW search. O(1) bit operations.
Data parallelism library with work-stealing. Essential for parallel HNSW construction/search. Convert iter() to par_iter() for automatic parallelization.
Lock-free concurrent data structures with epoch-based GC. 20x faster than Mutex-based implementations. Lock-free queues and channels for high-performance concurrent access.
Faster, smaller synchronization primitives. 1.5-5x faster than std::sync::Mutex. Superior RwLock for HNSW read-heavy workloads. Used by hnswlib-rs.
General matrix multiplication (GEMM) for f32/f64. Reference for optimized SIMD kernels with AVX2, FMA, and multithreading. Used by ndarray.
